lesson.title: After consonants
lesson.shortDescription: Vowels can be on the right side of consonants.
lesson.description:
In Tai Dam, a syllable starts with a consonant. If the vowel is a post-position form, it's written right next to the consonant, without any space in between. Imagine a right-vowel syllable that looks like this: ùê∂ + ùëâ.
So:
  Í™Ä + Í™± becomes Í™ÄÍ™± ("kaa"),
  Í™Å + Í™Ω becomes Í™ÅÍ™Ω ("kan"),
and
  Í™â + Í™∫ becomes Í™âÍ™∫ ("ngua").

lesson.title: Above consonants
lesson.shortDescription: Vowels can appear above consonants in syllables.
lesson.description:
Some Tai Dam vowels can sit above the consonant they follow. Start with the base consonant on the writing line, then place the vowel sign directly above it to finish the syllable‚Äîno extra marks are added to the left or right. For example,
  Í™ä + Í™≤ becomes Í™äÍ™≤ ("chi")
  Í™é + Í™≥ becomes Í™éÍ™≥ ("su"),
and
  Í™ê + Í™∑ becomes Í™êÍ™∑ ("hgno").

lesson.title: More practice
lesson.description: Extended practice with vowels that appear to the right and above consonants in Tai Dam syllables.

lesson.title: Multi-part vowels (Before and above consonants)
lesson.description:
Some Tai Dam vowels have two parts. These parts can appear before and above the consonant they belong to in a syllable. Imagine a left-vowel syllable that looks like this: ùëâ‚ÇÅ + ùê∂ + ùëâ‚ÇÇ.
So:
  Í™π + Í™é becomes Í™πÍ™é ("sue"),
  Í™πÍ™∑ + Í™Å becomes Í™πÍ™ÅÍ™∑ ("koe"),
and
  Í™πÍ™∏ + Í™é becomes Í™πÍ™éÍ™∏ ("se").

lesson.title: Below consonants, Multi-part before & after
lesson.description:
Tai Dam vowels can also sit below the consonant they belong to in a syllable. Vowels can also appear in combination before a consonant and after it. Imagine a syllable that looks like this: ùëâ‚ÇÅ + ùê∂ + ùëâ‚ÇÇ.
So:
  Í™é +  Í™¥ becomes Í™éÍ™¥ ("su"),
and
  Í™π + Í™é + Í™± becomes Í™πÍ™éÍ™± ("saw").

lesson.title: Review
lesson.description: A review lesson covering all consonants and vowels introduced in previous lessons.

lesson.title: Pre-consonant dipthongs
lesson.description: This lesson introduces three vowels (-ay, -a∆∞, -oh) and six consonants (f, 'f, m, 'm, y, 'y). The vowels ai and ae appear before the consonant, while oo also appears before the consonant. You'll practice combining these to form syllables like 'fay' (fire) and 'ma∆∞' (new).

lesson.title: Review
lesson.description: A review lesson covering all consonants and vowels introduced in previous lessons.

lesson.title: Consonants: l, v
lesson.description: This lesson introduces two new consonants: l and h. You'll learn how to combine these consonants with previously learned vowels to form syllables such as 'la' and 'ho'.
